choices.text:
### System:
You are an AI assistant that follows instruction extremely well. Help as much as you can.

### User:
why does this command give error Permission denied (publickey):

ssh -i \“~/UserKey.pem" -C -L 25900:localhost:5900 ec2-34-221-131-108.us-west-2.compute.amazonaws.com

### Response:


The command is giving an error because the file "~/UserKey.pem" does not have read/write access to the directory where the public key file is located (assuming it's in a separate directory). 

To resolve this issue, you need to provide the full path to your private key file and make sure that the user running the command has permission to write to the specified directory. Here's an example of how to fix the error:

```
ssh -i "/path/to/your/private/keyfile" -C -L 25900:localhost:5900 ec2-34-221-131-108.us-west-2.compute.amazonaws.com
```

Make sure to replace "/path/to/your/private/keyfile" with the actual path to your private key file and adjust the command accordingly if you have multiple private key files.
